name: The Double Talk Walk Quiz | Musicals | 20 Questions

questions.text: In "Prologue-Theme from City of Angels", what does Stone compare Los Angeles to?
questions.correct: A pretty girl with the clap
options: A criminal with a long rap sheet
An ugly girl with a heart of gold
questions.explanation:
A pretty girl with the clap.

	"When you get right down to it, L.A. isn't much different from a pretty girl with the clap."

questions.text: According to Stine in "Double Talk", who wrote the book on making movies out of books?
questions.explanation:
Buddy.

	"For making movies out of books They say that Buddy wrote the book I can depend on him to give me some lip But you can trust a guy who shoots from the hip."

questions.text: Finish the lyric: "How long ago did _______________ desert me?"
questions.explanation:
Good sense.

	"How long ago did good sense desert me I don't know why I still burn for you."

questions.text: Which character sings "You Gotta Look Out For Yourself"?
questions.explanation:
Jimmy Powers.

	"Ya gotta look out for yourself If you're hoping to be first Then ya better think 'me first' Or you're gonna be last."

questions.text: How many Oscars does Buddy say he has in the song "The Buddy System"?
questions.explanation:
A half dozen.

	He has twelve nominations, a half dozen Oscars, nine cars and three ex-wives.

questions.text: Bobbi sings "With Every Breath I Take".
questions.explanation:
True.

	Bobbi is a former lover of Stone's.

questions.text: According to Alaura in "The Tennis Song", why does her husband never play with her?
questions.explanation:
He's too easily winded.

	Alaura's husband is a weapons manufacturer who can usually be found in his iron lung.

questions.text: Whom is Stone searching for in the number "Ev'rybody's Gotta Be Somewhere"?
questions.explanation:
Mallory.

	Strangely, he finds her in the strangest of places, his own bed!

questions.text: Returning to his living quarters, Stone finds which person waiting for him?
questions.explanation:
Mallory.

	Mallory is found lying nude in Stone's bed, and she proceeds to sing "Lost and Found".

questions.text: Near the end of Act One, the police officer Munoz sings the cynical number "All You Have To Do Is Wait". What is Munoz's connection to Stone?
questions.explanation:
He is Stone's former partner.

	"All You Have To Do Is Wait" explains Stone's seemingly imminent demise in excruciating detail.

questions.text: Act One ends with the big band number "You're Nothing Without Me". Which two characters sing the song?
questions.explanation:
Stone and Stine.

	Stine, the writer, duels with Stone, the character. In the end, Stine uses his typewriter to teach Stone a painful lesson.

questions.text: Fill in the blank: "These ______________________ that we spend/ Never have to end."
questions.explanation:
Stolen moments.

	"These stolen moments that we spend Never have to end Save them in your heart I know they're sure to stay with me."

questions.text: "You Can Always Count on Me" is Oolie's song where she explains her love for Buddy.
questions.explanation:
False.

	"You Can Always Count on Me" explains Oolie's bad luck with the opposite gender.

questions.text: There is an instrumental number in between the songs "You Can Always Count on Me" and "It Needs Work". What is the number called?
questions.explanation:
Alaura's Theme.

	According to Buddy, "Alaura's Theme" will leave everybody crying with its beauty.

questions.text: Which character sings "It Needs Work"?
questions.explanation:
Gabby.

	Gabby evaluates Stine's alibi like a book in the song "It Needs Work". (Hey, that rhymes!)

questions.text: There is another instrument number in-between the songs "It Needs Work" and "With Every Breath I Take-Duet". What is it called?
questions.explanation:
L.A. Blues

	The trombone part in "L.A. Blues" was played by Jim Pugh.

questions.text: "With Every Breath I Take-Duet" is the first reprise of the show. Which two characters sing it?
questions.explanation:
Stone and Bobbi.

	Stone and Bobbi try to repair their broken hearts in this number, but it doesn't work out.

questions.text: In the next song, "Funny", Stine laments his fate. According to the rueful author, why does life force you into a smile?
questions.correct: So it can kick you in the teeth
options: So it can make you frown again
questions.explanation:
So it can kick you in the teeth.

	"Life double crosses with style Forcing you into a smile So it can kick you in the teeth."

questions.text: We're at the end of the show and everyone is happy again. As Stine and Stone sing "I'm Nothing Without You", who joins them?
questions.explanation:
Gabby.

	Gabby, Stine's wife, comes through for him in the end, thanks to Stone's use of the reality-altering typewriter.

questions.text: In "Epilogue-Theme From City of Angels", how many times do you go around?
questions.explanation:
Once.

	"You only go around once And then they tuck you in with a spade You're either under the gun Or unafraid." I hope you've enjoyed my quiz!
